item.title: Prominent global VC Endeavor Catalyst is raising $300M, sources say
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: Endeavor Catalyst, the co-investment fund affiliated with global entrepreneurial network Endeavor Global, is raising a new $300 million fund, its fifth and largest fund yet, as it looks to deepen its bet on high-growth startups across Africa, Latin America, the Middle East, and Southeast Asia, TechCrunch has learned. The new fund, according to sources, is […]

item.title: Google to scale up AI-powered fraud detection and security operations in India
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Google has unveiled its Safety Charter in India, which will expand its AI-led developments for fraud detection and combating scams across the country, the company’s largest market outside the United States. Digital fraud in India is rising. Fraud related to the Indian government’s instant payment system UPI grew 85% year-over-year to nearly 11 billion Indian […]

item.title: Spotify’s Daniel Ek just bet bigger on Helsing, Europe’s defense tech darling
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Spotify's Daniel Ek just led a €600 million investment in Helsing, a four-year-old, Munich-based defense tech company that is now valued at €12 billion, according to the Financial Times. The deal makes it one of Europe's most valuable privately held companies; it also highlights Europe's scramble to build its own military muscle as the world grows messier and the U.S. turns inward.

item.title: You can now set up double dates with friends on Tinder
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Tinder launched a new Double Date feature, which allows users to team up with friends and chat with potential matches together.

item.title: The cracks in the OpenAI-Microsoft relationship are reportedly widening
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: OpenAI and Microsoft have an increasingly strained relationship, according to a recent WSJ report.

item.title: Finland warms up the world’s largest sand battery, and the economics look appealing
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Pornainen recently turned on a 100 MWh thermal battery filled with ground up soapstone.

item.title: Instagram tests a reposts feature
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Instagram is testing the ability for users to repost posts, the company confirmed to TechCrunch on Monday.

item.title: Instagram users complain of mass bans, pointing finger at AI
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Instagram users report that their accounts were banned even though they had not violated the company's terms of service or other policies.

item.title: Deadline day: Startup Battlefield 200 applications close at midnight
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Battle it out in front of 10,000+ startup leaders, investors, and media at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025. It’s your moment to be seen, funded, and remembered — and maybe even walk away with $100,000 in equity-free funding.

item.title: Threads is testing spoiler text, Zuckerberg says
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Threads, Meta's microblogging platform, is testing spoiler text. This is a nice quality-of-life upgrade on the user side, but it also helps Meta by encouraging more conversations about pop culture without people worrying about spoiling others.

item.title: Patreon will increase the cut it takes from new creators
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Patreon is bumping its take fee from creators from 8% to 10%, but only for new signups.

item.title: As grocery shortages persist, UNFI says it’s recovering from cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: UNFI has not yet described the nature of the cyberattack, though it told investors last week that it had shut down its entire network to contain the incident. The ongoing outage is preventing the company from fulfilling and distributing customer orders at scale.

item.title: The investor experience at TechCrunch All Stage: One floor, infinite deal flow
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch All Stage isn’t a waiting room for warm intros — it’s a floor full of founders, ideas, and breakout potential. For VCs, it’s a rare chance to skip the filters and meet the future of tech in one place, on one day, with no layers between you and the next standout story. Whether you’re […]

item.title: Car-sharing giant Zoomcar says hacker accessed personal data of 8.4 million users
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The personal data includes customer names, phone numbers, and car registration numbers.

item.title: What makes TechCrunch All Stage different from other startup events? Answers to your most pressing questions
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Tech and startup events have a formula. You know it. We know it. We’ve all done it. But TechCrunch All Stage 2025, which we’re hosting July 15 at the SoWa Power Station in Boston, is designed to break out of that rinse-and-repeat model — and focus on what early-stage startups actually need to know, right […]

item.title: The founder experience at TechCrunch All Stage: Built for people building what’s next
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: For a founder, time is the one resource you can’t raise. That’s why TechCrunch All Stage — happening July 15 in Boston’s SoWa Power Station — is designed to make every minute count. Whether you’re at the whiteboard sketching v1 of your product or figuring out how to lead a team of 50, TechCrunch All […]

item.title: What to expect at TechCrunch All Stage: One day, countless connections and takeaways
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Whether you’re a founder gearing up for your next raise or a VC scouting your next portfolio win, TechCrunch All Stage, happening July 15 at Boston’s SoWa Power Station, packs more into one day than most multi-day conferences manage to deliver. This isn’t your typical sit-and-listen event. It’s designed to help you build momentum in […]

item.title: The countdown begins: 7 days left to save up to $210 on TechCrunch All Stage passes
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Less than 1 week to save up to $210 on TechCrunch All Stage passes! Founder or investor, this is your last chance to save big before June 23. Save now.

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer, Kate Park
item.description: A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2024.

item.title: Alta raises $11M to bring ‘Clueless’ fashion tech to life with all-star investors
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Users upload their closet by either taking photos, forwarding purchase receipts, or searching what is already in the Alta database. People can also dress themselves in clothes they are looking to buy, mixing and matching with clothes already in their closet.
